author: harishp
msg: Added a new ServletClassLoader that is a lot meaner and cleaner than the
earlier one. The previous one is still called ServletLoder, while this one
is called ServletClassLoader. After a few weeks, once this class loader
settles in, I will remove the old one (ServletLoader) from the core package.
Also added NetworkClassLoader, I recommend that JspLoader (& any other
class loaders) extend from this class loader. Firstly, it can load classes
off any URL. Secondly, it is modelled after JDK 1.2 style class loader.
Modified the servlet container to use this class loader instead of an
earlier one.

Obtained from:
Submitted by:
Reviewed by:

author: harishp
msg: Added 2 new scripts. One for unix and another for windoz.
Why?. startup and shutdown pretty much do the same thing..... Everytime
there is a change in the classpath/environment etc. we would need to
change both the scripts... Which is a drag..  "if-then-else"
statements are for exactly this purpose.....
These script are intended to replace startup and shutdown scripts.
You can now use:
./tomcat.sh -start
./tomcat.sh -stop
instead.
I don't have a windoz machine so, I could not test the tomcat.bat
script. It should work. Can someone verify it for me?
Once everyone moves over to the new script, the intent is to remove
startup and shutdown scripts.
I have changed the build.sh to give execute permission to all shell
script after building. I got tired to doing chmod +x startup.sh
everytime I did a clean build.

author: costin
msg: Added files from jserv's cvs - I'll keep the files in sync
by merging any changes/fixes in jserv.
This is the original code - no change to integrate it with
tomcat for now.
Mod_jserv will be used as the default adapter, since it is
stable and well tested - the bidirectional protocol will replace
it when ready.
